sentence.Network_en: Convictions will rise steeply now photographic evidence is admissible.
sentence.Network_cn: 既然照片证据可以接受，有罪判决将大幅增加。

sentence.Network_en: Parks has a tendency to become personally involved with his photographic subjects.
sentence.Network_cn: 帕克斯往往会跟他的拍摄对象产生感情纠葛。

sentence.Network_en: A photographic exhibition opens at the Royal College of Art on Wednesday.
sentence.Network_cn: 星期三一个摄影展在皇家艺术学院开幕。

entry.def: Photographic means connected with photographs or photography.

example.ex: The bank is able to provide photographic evidence of who used the machine.
example.tran: 银行能提供用过该机器的顾客的影像证据。

entry.def: If you have a photographic memory, you are able to remember things in great detail after you have seen them.

example.ex: He had a photographic memory for maps.

means.word_mean: 1. relating to photography or obtained by using photography;
2. representing people or nature with the exactness and fidelity of a photograph

Sentence.sentence: In 1976, the company commanded 90% of the market for photographic film and 85% of the market for cameras.

means.word_mean: 摄影(术)的;摄影用的;摄制的

sentences.en: Ensure all photographic material is properly packed and sent by recorded delivery.
sentences.cn: 确保把所有的摄影资料包装妥当并挂号寄出。

means.word_mean: (指某人的记忆)记得详细准确的

sentences.en: His photographic memory enabled him to tuck away yards of facts.
sentences.cn: 他过目不忘的记忆力使他能记下大量事实。
